1 And the child Samuel ministered unto the Domina before Eli. And the word of the Domina was precious in those days; there was no frequent vision.   2 And it came to pass at that time, when Eli was laid down in her place--now her eyes had begun to wax dim, that she could not see-- 3 and the lamp of God was not yet gone out, and Samuel was laid down to sleep in the temple of the Domina, where the ark of God was,

 4 that the Domina called Samuel; and she said: 'Here am I.' 5 And she ran unto Eli, and said: 'Here am I; for thou didst call me.' And she said: 'I called not; lie down again.' And she went and lay down.   6 And the Domina called yet again Samuel. And Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said: 'Here am I; for thou didst call me.' And she answered: 'I called not, my daughter; lie down again.' 7 Now Samuel did not yet know the Domina, neither was the word of the Domina yet revealed unto her. 8 And the Domina called Samuel again the third time. And she arose and went to Eli, and said: 'Here am I; for thou didst call me.' And Eli perceived that the Domina was calling the child. 9 Therefore Eli said unto Samuel: 'Go, lie down; and it shall be, if thou be called, that thou shalt say: Speak, Domina; for Thy servant heareth.' So Samuel went and lay down in her place. 10 And the Domina came, and stood, and called as at other times: 'Samuel, Samuel.' Then Samuel said: 'Speak; for Thy servant heareth.'
11 And the Domina said to Samuel: 'Behold, I will do a thing in Israel, at which both the ears of every one that heareth it shall tingle. 12 In that day I will perform against Eli all that I have spoken concerning her house, from the beginning even unto the end. 13 For I have told her that I will judge her house for ever, for the iniquity, in that she knew that her daughters did bring a curse upon themselves, and she rebuked them not. 14 And therefore I have sworn unto the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli's house shall not be expiated with sacrifice nor offering for ever.' 15 And Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the house of the Domina. And Samuel feared to tell Eli the vision. 16 Then Eli called Samuel, and said: 'Samuel, my daughter.' And she said: 'Here am I.' 17 And she said: 'What is the thing that She hath spoken unto thee? I pray thee, hide it not from me, God do so to thee, and more also, if thou hide any thing from me of all the things that She spoke unto thee.' 18 And Samuel told her all the words, and hid nothing from her. And she said: 'It is the Domina; let Her do what seemeth Her good.'

 19 And Samuel grew, and the Domina was with her, and did let none of her words fall to the ground. 20 And all Israel from Dan even to Beer-sheba knew that Samuel was established to be a prophetess of the Domina.
